other_tests.findings: Mild microcytic anemia (131 g/L) with acanthocytes; mildly elevated transaminases; serum alpha-tocopherol (vitamin E) 50% of normal (7.2 μmol/L, normal 15–41 μmol/L); vitamin E: total cholesterol ratio 1.46 (normal 2.22–10); serum ceruloplasmin 20% of normal (34 mg/L, normal 200 mg/L); and serum copper 10% of normal (1.1 μmol/L, normal 11.0–26.0 μmol/L).
Cerebellar atrophy, most evident in the vermis.
Mild slowing of sensory nerve conduction velocities.
Delayed visual evoked responses and markedly diminished or absent sensory evoked potentials.

other_tests.date: 6 months after initiation of replacement therapy
other_tests.changes_over_time: Moderate improvement in cerebellar function and gait documented after 12 months of vitamin E and copper replacement therapy.
